Inference: Confirming which flow anomalies are true leaks
Description: Flow anomalies that are consistently followed by leak detections in the same time window and zone are true leak-related anomalies.
short rationale: Event-specific correlation with zone and timing; strong reconstruction potential.

Inference: Flow anomalies that are just heavy usage
Description: Flow anomalies that almost never coincide with any leak detections represent legitimate high-usage patterns, not leaks.
short rationale: Characterizes benign usage patterns; limited privacy beyond occupancy timing.

Inference: Flow-based early warning pattern for leaks
Description: Repeated small flow anomalies that regularly occur before a leak is later recorded indicate a predictive stress signature for emerging leaks.
short rationale: Precursor patterns per zone/time; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Estimating leak size from anomaly magnitude
Description: For leak events with associated flow anomalies, the integrated magnitude (height Ã— duration) of the anomaly correlates with leak severity or volume.
short rationale: Quantifies event severity and timing; supports detailed incident reconstruction.

Inference: Distinguishing main-line failures from local branch leaks
Description: A single large flow anomaly followed by multiple leak detections across different locations suggests a main supply-line failure, while smaller anomalies with single leaks suggest local branch leaks.
short rationale: Reveals network topology and multi-zone impact; location-sensitive.

Inference: Chronic slow leaks vs. acute bursts
Description: Long, low-level flow anomalies that occasionally trigger small leak events indicate chronic slow leaks, while short, high spikes with immediate leak detections indicate acute bursts.
short rationale: Classifies leak type and timing; moderate incident specificity.

Inference: Identifying hidden leaks where leak sensors miss events
Description: Locations with frequent flow anomalies but very few or no leak detections likely have leaks that are not being captured by leak sensors.
short rationale: Highlights unsensed leaks tied to specific zones; notable location exposure.

Inference: Evaluating leak sensor reliability
Description: If most significant flow anomalies lead to leak detections but some zones show anomalies with no leaks recorded, the leak sensors in those zones may be faulty or misconfigured.
short rationale: Sensor reliability check per zone; low personal/behavior detail.

Inference: Tuning flow anomaly thresholds using leak outcomes
Description: Comparing flow anomaly sizes that did result in leak detections with those that did not helps tune thresholds to better separate harmful from harmless flow events.
short rationale: Policy/threshold tuning using aggregated outcomes; minimal privacy risk.

Inference: Differentiating fixture misuse from leaks
Description: Short-lived flow anomalies during high-occupancy periods that seldom produce leak records indicate usage spikes, whereas similar anomalies during low-occupancy periods that correlate with leaks signal actual failures.
short rationale: Links anomalies to occupancy timing vs. failure; moderate behavior exposure.

Inference: Cascading failures after a major anomaly
Description: A very large flow anomaly followed by multiple leak detections over a short period suggests that one major hydraulic event caused secondary leaks.
short rationale: Cascade timeline across zones; high reconstruction and location sensitivity.

Inference: Impact of shutoff timing on leak duration
Description: The gap between the end of a flow anomaly and the last leak detection shows how quickly damaging flow was stopped after being detected.
short rationale: Incident-specific mitigation timing; reveals response effectiveness.

Inference: Flow anomaly shape as a signature for specific leak types
Description: Distinct flow anomaly shapes that consistently correspond to particular leak patterns can be used as signatures for different failure modes.
short rationale: Pattern library for classification; low direct privacy impact.

Inference: Temporal ordering of flow anomaly and leak detection
Description: If leak detections usually lag behind flow anomalies, certain anomaly patterns can be treated as pre-leak warnings and trigger earlier alerts.
short rationale: Sequence-based warnings; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Identifying multi-source leaks from one anomaly
Description: A single continuous flow anomaly followed by multiple leak detections in different nearby zones indicates multiple leak points sharing the same upstream failure.
short rationale: Multi-zone spread tied to one event; high location/layout exposure.

Inference: Branch vulnerability scoring
Description: Branches that show both frequent flow anomalies and frequent leak detections can be scored as high-risk segments of the plumbing network.
short rationale: Branch-level risk map; location-specific but aggregated over time.

Inference: Recognizing benign baseline anomalies
Description: Flow anomalies that repeatedly occur at similar times and magnitudes but never align with leak detections form a pattern of benign baseline anomalies.
short rationale: Labels harmless patterns; limited privacy beyond routine timing.

Inference: Discovering pre-failure stress periods
Description: Leak clusters that occur after earlier short flow anomalies in the same general window suggest the system experienced stress periods before actually failing.
short rationale: Identifies stressed windows with timelines; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Evaluating effectiveness of pressure or flow control upgrades
Description: Before and after upgrades, comparing the number and magnitude of flow anomalies and the frequency of associated leaks indicates whether control improvements were effective.
short rationale: Pre/post comparison; aggregated, low personal exposure.

Inference: Confirming anomaly-driven vs. spontaneous leaks
Description: Leaks that regularly occur without any preceding flow anomaly are likely driven by material or structural issues rather than flow-induced stress.
short rationale: Classifies cause of incidents; moderate event specificity.

Inference: Calibrating anomaly duration as a proxy for leak duration
Description: Across incidents, the duration of flow anomalies aligned with leak events allows mapping anomaly duration to typical leak lifetime.
short rationale: Uses incident timing to infer leak length; moderate reconstruction risk.

Inference: Identifying over-sensitive leak sensing in high-flow areas
Description: Zones that log many small leak events whenever there is a moderate flow anomaly, with minimal actual damage, indicate overly sensitive leak detection relative to flow conditions.
short rationale: Zone-level sensor sensitivity insight; some location/timing exposure.

Inference: Characterizing system stress evolution over time
Description: An increase over months in both flow anomaly frequency and leak density suggests an aging system under growing hydraulic stress.
short rationale: Long-term trend analysis; low personal or event-specific risk.

Inference: Demand pattern learning with risk overlay
Description: Flow anomalies that align with predictable high-demand periods but only occasionally cause leaks help identify high-risk usage patterns.
short rationale: Reveals usage schedules and risk overlay; moderate behavior sensitivity.

Inference: Anomaly miss cost estimation
Description: For leaks that occurred without prior flow anomalies, the resulting damage defines the cost of missed anomaly detection and informs stricter anomaly thresholds.
short rationale: Links missed detections to damage estimates; incident-specific but limited identity exposure.
